rooms

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • rooms.Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes care of level generation and storage.
    It contains a number of static methods to help generate a level, most notably the generateLevel method which generate the entire level.
    The Level class can also have an object constructed of it which contains all of the rooms and enemies and doors and enemies needed to make the game run.
    Author:
    Hughes

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(int stage)
        The only constructor. Takes stage as a parameter, although perhaps that should just be removed altogether.
        Constructs the entire level and gives values to all of the rooms.
        Parameters:
        stage - The current stage of the level

    • Method Detail

      • generateLevel

        public static Room[][] generateLevel(int stage)
        This method is the heart of the class. It generates every level procedurally.
        Parameters:
        stage - The level of the game
        Returns:
        the level as a Room[][]

      • itemRoom

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Item> itemRoom()
        Generates an item room list of enemies and objects.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of objects for an item room

      • regRoom

        public static java.util.ArrayList<BasicEnemy> regRoom(int level)
        Generates a normal room with normal enemies based on the level.
        Parameters:
        level - The current level, used to determine difficulty
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of enemies for the room

      • generateDoors

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Door> generateDoors(Room[][] level,
                                                      int row,
                                                      int col)
        Generates a set of doors for a new room given its location in the level.
        Parameters:
        level - The preexisting level
        row - The row of the room
        col - The column of the room
        Returns:
        ArrayList of doors for the room

      • move

        public void move(int direction)
        This method should be invoked whenever a Door is touched by the character.
        It moves the location of the character in the direction of the Door that they touch.

        There are 4 constant direction Integers: LEFT, RIGHT, UP, and DOWN.
        They should be passed to this method in the direction of movement.

        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to be moved

        public Room getCurrentRoom()

        public int getStage()
